results.title: Wire sculpture
results.brief_description: An exploration into the design and construction of “kinetic” sculpture with steel wire and acetylene torch. Joe Police, a freelance artist, constructs a movable sculpture of a human head. He relates his experiences in learning his craft and comments on his philosophy of art and creativity. The film is complimented by Peter Coraggio’s “Electronic Sound Sculpture”.

results.title: Wir Stellen Uns Vor
results.brief_description: Designed for students of elementary German. Consists of three self contained documentary film sequences showing young Germans using simple language in authentic exchanges from their everyday lives.

results.title: Wipe Out the Jargon (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Eve Ash, Seven Dimensions and Ted Robinson
results.brief_description: The characters in this madcap program (a pen, a pencil and liquid paper) spearhead an attack on jargon and woolly-writing. They demonstrate how to improve letter and report writing skills by isolating the four principles of clear, well structured letters and reports: Be clear, Order, Evaluate. Short notes accompany the program.

results.title: Winterfun Canada
results.creator_credit: Jim Turpie, Crawley Films and Pat Crawley
results.brief_description: This film is a lively mosaic of how Canadians use winter as a source of recreation and entertainment. We go from coast to coast catching a view of virtually every winter sport and outdoor pastime - from the grace of figure skating to the mayhem of a car race on a frozen lake. Aside from all the action, the camera often stops along the way and lingers on the frozen stillness of the long Canadian Winter. No narration.

results.title: Winter of the witch
results.creator_credit: Thomas Sand, Parents' Magazine Films, Learning Corporation of America and Gerald Herman
results.brief_description: Nicky and his mother buy an old house where a three hundred-year-old witch lives. Each day Nick brings her the paper and she realizes that everyone is so sad that there is no need to scare them anymore. She becomes the family cook and amazes everyone with her “happiness” pancakes, until her motive is revealed. Based on “Old Black Witch” by Wende and Harry Devlin. Narrated by Burgess Meredith. Suitable for primary school level.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Thomas Sand, Parents’ Magazine Films, Learning Corporation of America and Gerald Herman

results.title: Winter moths
results.creator_credit: Stephen Ackroyd, Shell Film Unit and J.V. Durden
results.brief_description: Describes in detail the life cycle and habits of the true winter moth; the attack on the flower buds of fruit tress and later the much more destructive assaults on their foliage. Shows also the destruction caused by the March moth.

results.title: Winter garden. Sailor's consolation. Check to song
results.creator_credit: Michael Warne, Joan Maude, John Halas, Halas and Batchelor Cartoon Films and British Film Institute
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Painter and poet: an experiment in words, music and paintings”.
The second part of a series devised by Joan Maude and Michael Warre incorporating the works of writers, painters and musicians to create an experimental animated film. This part consists of three short films. ‘Winter garden’ by David Gascoigne, narrated by Michael Redgrave, painted by Barbara Jones (2:17 mins). ‘The Sailor’s consolation’ by Thomas Dibden, narrated by Stanley Holloway, drawings by John Minton (1:40 mins). ‘Check to song!’ by Owen Meredith, narrated by Eric Portman, drawings by Michael Warre (1:10 mins). Photography by W. Traylor and R. Turk, music by Matyas Seiber, edited by Jack King.
